title: Plotting with woylier
text: 1D projection data high dimension linear combination data normalized. Therefore, can plot point surface hypersphere. plot Givens interpolation steps 2 points, 1D projection 6D data .
code: # Generate 1D example set.seed(2022) p <- 6 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1)  # First example frames <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, nsteps = 10) sp <- generate_space_view(p=p) sp_path <- add_path(sp, frames)  point1 <- as.data.frame(t(base1))  point1$type <- "point1" point2 <- as.data.frame(t(base2)) point2$type <- "point2" sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, point1, point2)  p #> [1] 6 tourr::animate_xy(sp_path[,1:p], col=sp_path$type,                    axes="bottomleft") #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 1

title: Plotting with woylier
text: case 2D projections, can plot interpolated path 2 frames surface torus. Torus can seen crossing 2 circles orthonormal.
code: # Generate 2D example set.seed(2022) n <- 1000 p <- 3 d <- 2 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d) frames_2d <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, 10) proj_2d <- map(1:n, ~tourr::basis_random(n = p,  d=d)) %>%   purrr::flatten_dbl() %>%    matrix(ncol = p*2, byrow = TRUE) %>%   as_tibble() #> Warning: The `x` argument of `as_tibble.matrix()` must have unique column names if #> `.name_repair` is omitted as of tibble 2.0.0. #> ℹ Using compatibility `.name_repair`. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. # Path path_2d <- t(apply(frames_2d, 3, c)) %>%    as.data.frame() # Join proj_2d <- proj_2d %>%    mutate(type="torus") path_2d <- path_2d %>%    mutate(type="path") proj_path <- bind_rows(proj_2d, path_2d) tourr::animate_xy(proj_path[,1:6],                    col=proj_path$type,                    axes="bottomleft") #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 1.5

title: woylier
text: can install development version woylier GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("numbats/woylier") library(woylier) library(geozoo) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(purrr)

title: woylier
text: example, 2 random 1D basis 6D data space givens_full_path() function returns intermediate interpolation step projections given number steps. code chunk demonstrates interpolation 2 random basis 5 steps.

text: example, 2 random 2D basis 6D data space givens_full_path() function returns intermediate interpolation step projections given number steps. code chunk demonstrates interpolation 2 random basis 5 steps.

Batsaikhan Z, Cook D, Laa U (2023). “Frame frame interpolation high-dimensional data visualisation using woylier package.” doi:10.48550/arXiv.2311.08181, 2311.08181.

title: Alternative Tour Frame Interpolation Method
text: “woylier” package provides alternative method generating tour path interpolating d-D frames p-D space rather d-D planes.

title: Alternative Tour Frame Interpolation Method
text: can install development version woylier GitHub :

title: Interpolation format for tourr — givens_path
text: Generates interpolation form needed tourr, modelled geodesic_path()

title: Interpolation format for tourr — givens_path
Interpolation format for tourr — givens_path
text: current starting frame target target frame frozen indicator whether dimensions fixed ... arguments sent later functions

title: Interpolation format for tourr — givens_path
text: interpolate function single parameter [0, 1] returns interpolated frame current future frames. 0 gives current plane, 1 gives new target frame plane current frame. dist distance, radians, current target frames. Fa current frame. Fz new target frame. tau principle angles current target frames. Ga current plane. Gz target plane.

code: guided_tour_givens(   index_f,   d = 2,   alpha = 0.5,   cooling = 0.99,   max.tries = 25,   max.i = Inf,   optim = "search_geodesic",   n_sample = 100,   ... )

title: Create a guided tour with Givens interpolation — guided_tour_givens
text: index_f index function optimize. d target dimensionality alpha initial size search window, radians cooling amount size search window adjusted step max.tries maximum number unsuccessful attempts find better projection giving max.maximum index value, stop search larger value found optim character indicating search strategy use: search_geodesic, search_better, search_better_random, search_polish. Default search_geodesic. n_sample number samples generate search_f search_polish ... arguments sent search_f

title: A planned tour path using frame-to-frame interpolation. — planned_tour_givens
code: library(tourr) twod <- save_history(flea[, 1:3], max = 5) #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. str(twod) #>  num [1:3, 1:2, 1:5] 1 0 0 0 1 ... #>  - attr(*, "data")= num [1:74, 1:3] 0.467 0.263 0.773 -0.145 -0.213 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:74] "1" "2" "3" "4" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:3] "tars1" "tars2" "head" tourr::animate_xy(flea[, 1:3], woylier::planned_tour_givens(twod)) #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 3.5   tourr::animate_xy(flea[, 1:3], woylier::planned_tour_givens(twod, TRUE)) #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 3.5   oned <- tourr::save_history(flea[, 1:6], tourr::grand_tour(1), max = 3) #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. tourr::animate_dist(flea[, 1:6], woylier::planned_tour_givens(oned)) #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 4.4

what: woylier: Alternative Tour Frame Interpolation Method — woylier-package
title: woylier: Alternative Tour Frame Interpolation Method — woylier-package
text: method generates tour path interpolating d-D frames p-D using Givens rotations. algorithm arises problem zeroing elements matrix. interpolation method useful showing specific d-D frames tour, opposed d-D planes, done geodesic interpolation. useful projection pursuit indexes s invariant. See details Buj, Cook, Asimov Hurley (2005) doi:10.1016/S0169-7161(04)24014-7  Batsaikhan, Cook Laa (2023) doi:10.48550/arXiv.2311.08181 .

title: woylier: Alternative Tour Frame Interpolation Method — woylier-package
